message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SD

The paper proposes a method to synthesize images from spatio-temporal representations using spiking autoencoders and spike-based backpropagation. This work involves the use of neural networks for image synthesis and processing, which falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the use of spiking neural networks and event-driven neuromorphic hardware is a topic of interest in the neural networks (cs.NE) sub-category. The paper also involves the use of audio data and multi-modal learning, which falls under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of direct training algorithms and loss computation, which falls under the software engineering (cs.SD) sub-category.
